page.title: 06THE FENSTANTON CHURCH
page.content: The{Parish Church of St.Peter and {St.Paul}is very old.One of the panels dates from{13th Century. { The spire and weathercock}of this Church were damaged by a storm in 1957 and were restored in October 1960. The cost was contributed in{memory 0f {Fredrick William Chillery}who died in 1959. The{plaque}of{Lancelot Brown}is on one wall,opposite the organ made by Norman Hall and sons.There are 34 pipes.The{stained glass windows}are in memory of{Stanley Walton.}The{pulpit has 6 steps and either side is an altar. There are{six bells.}One was given by the{John Howland Society. As they have not been cleaned for 90 years,the{elm headstocks}are wormeaten. The{choir pews}have {carvings}on them and there is carving on some of the beams.
